p: Currently, it is estimated that approximately 37 million people live with HIV in the world, characterizing it as one of the main threats to public health, especially in low or middle income countries ( 1 ). Despite all the progress made in recent years and the reduction of annual infections by 3% in the period from 2007 to 2017, this infection continues to spread throughout the world, leading to 1.8 million new infections/year and 1 million deaths/year ( 1 ).
